freenet.clients.http
Interface ToadletContext

All Known Implementing Classes:
ToadletContextImpl
public interface ToadletContext

Object represents context for a single request. Is used as a token, when the Toadlet wants to e.g. write a reply.

Method Detail

sendReplyHeaders

void sendReplyHeaders(int code,
                      String desc,
                      MultiValueTable<String,String> mvt,
                      String mimeType,
                      long length,
                      Date mTime)
                      throws ToadletContextClosedException,
                             IOException
Write reply headers.

Parameters:
code - HTTP code.
desc - HTTP code description.
mvt - Any extra headers.
mimeType - The MIME type of the reply.
length - The length of the reply.
mTime - The modification time of the data being sent or null for 'now' and disabling caching
Throws:
ToadletContextClosedException
IOException

IOException

writeData

void writeData(byte[] data,
               int offset,
               int length)
               throws ToadletContextClosedException,
                      IOException
Write data. Note you must send reply headers first.

Throws:
ToadletContextClosedException
IOException

forceDisconnect

void forceDisconnect()
Force a disconnection after handling this request. Used only when a throwable was thrown and we don't know what the state of the connection is. FIXME we could handle this better by remembering whether headers have been sent, how long the attached data should be, how much data has been sent etc.

writeData

void writeData(byte[] data)
               throws ToadletContextClosedException,
                      IOException
Convenience method that simply calls writeData(byte[], int, int).

Parameters:
data - The data to write
Throws:
ToadletContextClosedException - if the context has already been closed
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

writeData

void writeData(Bucket data)
               throws ToadletContextClosedException,
                      IOException
Write data from a bucket. You must send reply headers first.

Throws:
ToadletContextClosedException
IOException

                         URI path,
                         String name)
                         throws ParseException
Get an existing Cookie (sent by the client) from the headers.

ParseException

setCookie

void setCookie(Cookie newCookie)
Set a Cookie, it will be sent with the reply headers to the client.

addFormChild

HTMLNode addFormChild(HTMLNode parentNode,
                      String target,
                      String id)
Add a form node to an HTMLNode under construction. This will have the correct enctype and formPassword set already, so all the caller needs to do is add its specific fields.

Parameters:
parentNode - The parent HTMLNode.
target - Where the form should be POSTed to.
id - HTML name for the form for stylesheet/script access. Will be added as both id and name.
Returns:
The form HTMLNode.

isAllowedFullAccess

boolean isAllowedFullAccess()
Is this Toadlet allowed full access to the node, including the ability to reconfigure it, restart it etc?

Return a robots.txt excluding all spiders and other non-browser HTTP clients?
